Key Match Events: Detroit guard Jaden Ivey sustained what appeared to be a severe injury to his lower left leg in the fourth quarter of Detroit’s victory over the Orlando Magic on Wednesday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Pistons coach J.B. Bickerstaff said after Detroit’s 105–96 victory. “There’s no better person or teammate than J.I. and no one cares more about this than he does. I give the guys credit for getting it done - they care about him and they didn’t want to let him down.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ivey led the Pistons with 22 points.
Players from both teams consoled both Ivey and Anthony, who was noticeably shaken by the play.
Others: Orlando’s Cole Anthony slipped and fell as he and Ivey went for the ball. Anthony’s momentum carried him into Ivey’s planted leg, knocking Ivey to the floor.
